page.title: 06EDUCATION. WILLEY
page.content: The area though covering few houses, has a number of young people aged 10 to 24. Those still at school travel 8km by coach to Wigmore. After taking G.C.E. 'O' level exams they go to Leominster or Hereford schools or colleges of further education to study 'A' levels or courses in business studies, catering, nursing or other courses designed to lead to higher education. Most of the boys go to agriculture college and return to work on their father's farm. One boy is studying ecology at a polytechnic. Unlike their mothers, most girls expect to leave the area and few expect to return when their training is complete.
